intro: Lachnostachys ferruginea, commonly known as the rusty leaved grass, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the grass family Poaceae and is characterized by its slender, tufted growth habit. The plant features narrow, linear leaves with a distinctive rusty or reddish-brown coloration on the underside. Its inflorescence consists of a dense, spike-like cluster of small, two-lipped flowers. Lachnostachys ferruginea is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments.
